Description: Israel begins a new military operation in the West BankJanuary 21 Prime Minister Israel Benjamin Netanyahu announcedthe start of a military operation in Jenin, a city in The West Bank, which is part of the Palestinian Authority. According to him, this operation is -another step towards achieving this goal.- He added that Israel is acting decisively against the -Iranian axis,- which is sending weapons to various regions, including Gaza, Lebanon, Syria, Yemen, and Judea and Samaria.By information from the pro-Palestinian publication Al Jazeera, the operation has already killed six Palestinians and injured 35 people.This is not Israel's first military operation Jenin: The IDF last conducted military operations in this city in August 2024. Following the 1996 Oslo Accords, Israel transferred control of the city to the Palestinian National Authority. However, in recent years, the influence of the Palestinian authorities in the region has weakened, and, according to some sources, they have lost control of the Jenin area.Palestinians called Jenin is the -capital of martyrs,- while the Israelis call it a -hornet‚Äôs nest.-Recall that earlier on January 19 officially a ceasefire agreement between Israel and the Hamas group in the Gaza Strip came into force.It also became known today that the IDF Chief of Staff Herzi Halevi resigned, taking personal responsibility for the failure of the Israeli army during the Hamas attack on October 7. The document later grew into a bill passed by Congress on a bipartisan basis and signed by Joe Biden. At the same time, the social network was banned from being used on government devices, and a number of states limited the access of regional government employees to TikTok.

Title: üé¨ 49 people became infected with hepatitis B and C in the Kamcha...
Description: 49 people became infected with hepatitis B and C in the Kamchatka cancer clinic due to the negligence of medical workersAccording to the Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky court, from November 2023 to December 2024, 49 cases of infection: 36 of them an acute form of the disease was diagnosed, and a chronic form of the disease. It is alleged that all those infected underwent a computed tomography (CT) scan with contrast. The information was confirmed by the head of the regional Ministry of Health, Alexander Gashkov (on video).After the outbreak, experts from Moscow were brought in to conduct an epidemiological investigation. They found that the infection spread due to violations of sanitary standards - lack of antiseptics, improper handling of equipment and the use of multi-dose bottles of saline solution. In addition, the virus can be transmitted to patients due to the fact that staff did not clean their hands and used disposable instruments several times.There may be more people infected, since about 1,000 people had MRIs with contrast in the office. Now the work of the CT room has been suspended for a month. The Investigative Committee in Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky opened a criminal case on the fact of criminal negligence of unidentified employees of the Kamchatka Regional Oncology Dispensary, which negligently resulted in the infliction of grievous harm to human health (Part 2 of Article 293 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation). Title: üñº In the Altai Territory, a train conductor dropped off an 81-ye...
Description: In the Altai Territory, a train conductor dropped off an 81-year-old pensioner at night in the middle of the forestAn elderly woman was traveling by train from Barnaul to Polzunovo station and asked the conductor to remember to open the door for her . She sent her to the next carriage, where, in response to the same request, another conductor -waved her hand and went about her business.- The woman went out to the vestibule in advance so as not to miss her stop, but no one opened the door. The pensioner ran to another carriage, but the train had already started moving, and the conductor closed the door literally in front of her.-In response to her pleas to break the stop valve and let her out, she replied that it was her own fault, she went into the wrong vestibule, but The stop valve will not be pulled off, because literally -they will deprive the bonus, but the salary is only 30 thousand!-, - told by the woman's daughter. As a result, the pensioner was dropped off at the next station in the forest. -There is forest all around, complete darkness, not a single lamp nearby, no houses visible. Frost about 20 degrees. I saw some path, thought that it led to housing and walked along it. Then it turned out that this path led into the forest to the -Path of Health- and went in the other direction from the house! But in the darkness it was impossible to make out anything. Then, finally, I was able to reach her by phone. that she left in Lebyazhka and got lost in the forest and that‚Äôs it, the connection was lost! More than two hours!-writes the victim‚Äôs daughter. Lebyazhka is located 3 km from the railway line. As a result, the woman reached the nearest houses by the barking of dogs. Her relatives took her from there. The Barnaul Transport Prosecutor's Office will check information about -inadequate provision of services,- the department said.

Title: üñº In the Russian Federation, the first sentence was handed down ...
Description: In the Russian Federation, the first sentence was passed on an air defense officer who, instead of a drone, shot down a helicopter with three military personnel - KommersantIgor Pashkov, who served as a senior assistant at the operational duty command post of one of the units Air defense forces stationed in Russian-occupied Crimea became the first defendant in a criminal case under Part 3 of Article 293 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (-Negligence-), manifested during repelling the alleged attack of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, reports the newspaper.As established by the garrison military court of Sevastopol, October 18, 2023 in 6:30 in the morning, when Pashkov was on combat duty, he received a report about the detection of a low-flying, low-speed air target.The head of the combat crew gave his call sign, but the officer made a mistake in the number and reported to management that the unidentified target was located in a different location . As a result, a decision was made to destroy it. The check showed that -there are no aircraft of our own- in the indicated area, and two minutes after the first message, a helicopter was shot down by a missile from the TOR-M2DT anti-aircraft missile system. Later it turned out that the downed Mi-8MTV-5-1, which fell into the Black Sea, was Russian, and three members of its crew, captains, died.Military investigative bodies of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation opened a criminal case for violation of combat rules duty, which led to grave consequences. Pashkov admitted his guilt in May 2024, admitting the mistake that led to the downing of a Russian Aerospace Forces helicopter. The investigation charged him with negligence for careless attitude to service, which led to false information about the aircraft.The Garrison Court found Pashkov guilty, but he took advantage of Article 51 of the Constitution and refused to testify. The court ordered him to pay 5 million rubles to the Ministry of Defense and compensate moral damages to the widows of the pilots in the amount of 1 million rubles each. In the appeal, the parties appealed the verdict, claiming insufficient severity of punishment and unlawful mitigation of circumstances.The Southern District Military Court, having reviewed the verdict, reduced Pashkov‚Äôs sentence to two years and ten months in a penal colony, taking into account his admission of guilt and repentance and other mitigating circumstances, such as having a dependent disabled son and positive characteristics.

Title: A court in Russia for the first time recognized the right of the ...
Description: A court in Russia for the first time recognized the right of the brothers and sons of killed conscripts not to serve in the army - -Conscript School-On the decision of the sixth cassation court of general jurisdiction in the case of Ivan Smolnikov from Kirovo- Chepetsk activists of the human rights project drew attention.Smolnikov sued the military registration and enlistment office for the right to a deferment from service due to the death of his brother in the war. The court of first instance rejected the claim, citing the fact that military mobilization service is equivalent to contract service and cannot be considered conscription service.After this, Smolnikov filed an appeal to the Kirov Regional Court and won. The court ordered the draft commission to consider the issue of releasing Smolnikov from conscription, indicating that the mobilization service is considered conscription, and the brothers and sons of those killed during its passage have the right not to serve. This decision was confirmed in the court of cassation.-Now the brothers and sons of the deceased conscripts can demand from the military registration and enlistment office an exemption from military conscription service. This right is enshrined in Article 23 of Federal Law No. 53 and confirmed by the ruling of the Sixth Court of Cassation of June 13, 2024 No. 88a-13860/2024,- says the material from the -Conscript School.-
